docs.lead_paragraph: WALKS.--Many of our lady citizens are not aware, from experience, that they have near them some of the finest rambling places in the Union.

headline.main: MOVEMENTS OF GEN. SCOTT.; His Departure from the City--Enthusiastic Receptions at Jersey City and Newark--Speeches, Incidents, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. SCOTT arose at an early hour yesterday morning, after an excellent night's rest at the Astor House. He seemed quite refreshed from the fatigue of his journey.
docs.snippet: Gen. SCOTT arose at an early hour yesterday morning, after an excellent night's rest at the Astor House. He seemed quite refreshed from the fatigue of his journey.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE HEALTH 0F CHARLESTON.--The cases of yellow fever in Charleston last week were less numerous than they had been, although the number of deaths had rather increased towards the close, in consequence of the coldness of the weather.
docs.snippet: THE HEALTH 0F CHARLESTON.--The cases of yellow fever in Charleston last week were less numerous than they had been, although the number of deaths had rather increased towards the close, in consequence of the coldness of the weather.

headline.main: FROM PEMBINA.; Improvements in Pembina Colony--From Hudson's Bay.

docs.lead_paragraph: Since I last wrote to you, this Colony has been actively engaged in efforts to restore what was destroyed by the great flood in May last. The loss was immense in houses, fences, cattle, and even household furniture, and the suffering consequent thereon has been in a corresponding ratio.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: We have reason to know that while Mr. WEBSTER is by no means so seriously ill as some of the current rumors would imply, the statement that his health is as good as usual is incorrect.
docs.snippet: We have reason to know that while Mr. WEBSTER is by no means so seriously ill as some of the current rumors would imply, the statement that his health is as good as usual is incorrect.

headline.main: Arrival of Gen. Scott in New-York--Enthusiastic Reception by the Citizens.

docs.lead_paragraph: General SCOTT arrived at the depot of the Hudson River Railroad, corner Chambers-street, at 4 P. M., yesterday. Long before that hour, numbers had been gathering, and by the time the train arrived, the crowd assembled was so dense that it was with difficulty the cars could proceed to the terminus of the road.

docs.lead_paragraph: GEN. SCOTT, who reached this City yesterday afternoon, from West Point, and took up his quarters at the Astor House, will leave them this morning at 9 o'clock for Jersey City, and thence by the 10 o'clock train to Newark, passing on in the afternoon to his old home in Elizabeth town, where he will spend the night.
docs.snippet: GEN. SCOTT, who reached this City yesterday afternoon, from West Point, and took up his quarters at the Astor House, will leave them this morning at 9 o'clock for Jersey City, and thence by the 10 o'clock train to Newark, passing on in the afternoon...

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE; By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. MOVEMENTS OF GENERAL SCOTT. Departure from Syracuse-Arrival at Utica-Speeches, Incidents, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: General SCOTT left Syracuse at 8 o'clock this morning, in charge of the Utica Committee of Reception --Mr. SAMUEL THOMPSON, on their behalf, having met him at Rochester. At several places along the route, large crowds collected to great the General.
docs.snippet: General SCOTT left Syracuse at 8 o'clock this morning, in charge of the Utica Committee of Reception --Mr. SAMUEL THOMPSON, on their behalf, having met him at Rochester. At several places along the route, large crowds collected to great the General.

headline.main: WASHINGTON.; Our Foreign Relations--The Secretary of State--Washington City--Improvements.

docs.lead_paragraph: The continued illness of the Secretary of State is a public misfortune. There have been few occasions more urgently requiring the attendance of the responsible head of that Department at his post, than the present. Mr. WEBSTER will probably never return to Washington.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The following has just been issued by Gov. HUNT: PROCLAMATION BY WASHINGTON HUNT, GOVERNOR OF THE STATE OF NEW-YORK. The varied blessings enjoyed by the people of this State during the past year call forth the grateful tribute of praise and devotion due to our Heavenly Benefactor.
